content:
Congratulations on your win! Completing six out of eight Destination Tickets is a great achievement, especially when you had to outmaneuver your roommate Mike's attempts to block you. It sounds like it was a thrilling game!

Getting the base game and the Europe expansion is an excellent idea. The base game will provide a solid foundation for you to learn the mechanics and gameplay, and the Europe expansion will offer a new map, new challenges, and new opportunities to explore. The Europe map is a bit more complex than the North America map, with more routes and connections, so it'll provide a nice change of pace.

With the Europe expansion, you'll get to experience new features like the ferry routes, which add an extra layer of strategy to the game. You'll also get to explore new cities and routes, which can help you develop different strategies and approaches.

Remember, the key to winning at Ticket to Ride is to balance your short-term goals (completing individual routes) with your long-term goals (completing your Destination Tickets). It's great that you were able to stay focused and adapt to Mike's attempts to block you.

Now that you've got the base game and the Europe expansion on your radar, I'm curious: have you thought about playing with other expansions or spin-offs in the future? There are some great ones out there, like the Märklin edition, which adds a new level of complexity with its passenger mechanics.

Let me know if you have any other questions or if there's anything else I can help you with!
